definition: regardless of weather conditions/rain, hail or shine
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to hinder/to block/to obstruct

sentences.english: He's always working in his garden - come rain or shine .
sentences.chinese: 他總在花園裏幹活，風雨無阻。

sentences.english: We must struggle against our own laziness and stay with our training, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須跟自己的懶惰做鬥爭，堅持鍛鍊，風雨無阻。

sentences.english: But teams play football rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 但玩足球可以風雨無阻。

sentences.english: She worked as a volunteer helping women and children, eight hours a day, six days a week.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個幫助婦女和兒童的志願者，風雨無阻。

sentences.english: Donating your blood not only shows your affection, but also saves human life under any circumstance, .
sentences.chinese: 無償獻血奉獻愛心，拯救生命風雨無阻。

sentences.english: But teams play football rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 可是，美式足球卻是風雨無阻的。

sentences.english: The fete will take place on Sunday, rain or shine.
sentences.chinese: 遊園義賣會定於星期日舉行，風雨無阻。

sentences.english: Loves on the road, always in all weather, even if is the tear flows out unceasingly.
sentences.chinese: 愛在路上，從來就風雨無阻，哪怕是眼淚不斷流出。

sentences.english: Above, Huang Te - ho has braved the weather every day to clean the streets, for twenty - eight years.
sentences.chinese: 黃德和每日風雨無阻地清掃街道，廿八年如一日。

definition: simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
accustomed to/used to
as before/as in the past
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
hand in hand
to enjoy sth and never tire of it (idiom)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
easy/with no difficulty
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to arrive late
noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to go on a scenic tour
